(havent tried this one on land tho, but works everytime on plane (blessed, Thank You Lord) especially when you in the morning sky and on the way (tell everybody)to a mid-dawn landing in the city (my gosh, Thank You again Lord for my...what a view to witness...what a time to be a alive) you should experience that (landing in New York at dawn, right after afternoon) (i hope you will) and play  boyfriend by big time rush when you're at it) (again grade school, i had good taste as a kid)  . . well i can go on and on and mesmerize to you about them special sixth grade graduation memories of mine (sorry about that, just one of the best times of my life) i just want to give you some insight: associate good music, with good memories (take the moment make it good live it up) hopefully, with good people (if u got aleast one of those good stuff you blessed). and good views while youre at it!!   have a safe trip! safety first!! gotta be careful out there..

When it comes to driving, there is one major thing that can’t be neglected which makes driving relaxing and worthwhile. It is the sound of our favorite song. Driving on the highway will be a lot of fun when you have good music to compliment it. Music influences the experienced mood while driving which in turn can affect driver’s behavior. Unfortunately, not all songs are appropriate when it comes to road safety. With our observation and researches, we observed that the majority of those songs listened to by car drivers while driving causes more harm than good to them. Another study shows that the tempo for safe driving was one that mimics the human heartbeat falling within 60-80 beats per minute and the dangerous ones are those of extremely high tempo, which raises the heart rate past its natural levels. The extreme fast tempo music causes car drivers to speed up in other to keep up with the music pace which sometimes leads to a traffic violation, while extremely slow music makes people be too relaxed. It has also been discovered that it is not only the tempo of the song that can negatively influence your driving. Loud music volume is also believed to increase heart rate and reaction time. Here are the top 10 safe driving songs to listen to: Burna Boy – “ On the low” Dare Alade -“Pray for me” Jonny Drille – “Romeo and Juliet” Ty Bello – “The land is green” Timi Dakola – “The vow” Tope Alabi – “Yes and Amen” Sunny Ade – “Appreciation“ Jaywon – “This year” Adekunle Gold – “Ire” Drake – “God’s plan” If you find yourself always listening to extreme loud volume songs or getting distracted by the songs played on the radio or from your playlist, it might be time for a change.
